clinical_study.official_title: Non-stick Gel Applicated After Scraping Surgery for Natural Miscarriage and Uterine Synechiae Prevention

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary purpose of the study is to compare efficiency of a non-stick gel application after scraping surgery for natural miscarriage with no non-stick gel application after scraping surgery.
Post-scraping uterine synechiae rate will be established at the diagnostical hysteroscopy 6-8 weeks after surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
Women patients coming for natural miscarriage will be compared according to whether a non-stick gel will be applicated or not after scraping surgery.
6-8 weeks after this surgery uterine synechiae rate will be established at a diagnostical hysteroscopy. Proofreading of this exam will be made by 2 experts at the end of the study without knowing the randomization arm.
Long-term follow-up of the patients will be performed to evaluate the effect of the non-stick gel application on post-surgical fertility at 6, 12, and 24 months after scraping surgery using questionnaire asked by post, mail or phone.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of post-surgical uterine synechiae rate during a diagnostical hysteroscopy.
primary_outcome.description: Diagnostical hysteroscopy performed 6-8 weeks after scraping surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the effect of the non-stick gel application on the post-surgical fertility 6, 12, and 24 months after scraping surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation using questionnaires asked by post, mail or phone at 6, 12, and 24 months after scraping surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the obstetric complication rate 12 and 24 months after scraping surgery.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation of the obstetric complication rate 12 and 24 months after scraping surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation using questionnaires asked by post, mail or phone at 12 and 24 months after scraping surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of post-surgical synechiae stretch and severity
secondary_outcome.description: Synechiae stretch and severity will be evaluated by the American Fertility Society classification (rAFS).

secondary_outcome.measure: Consistency assessment between synechiae evaluation performed at the diagnostical hysteroscopy and the synechiae evaluation performed by the 2 experts at the end of the study
secondary_outcome.description: Synechiae stretch and severity will be evaluated by the American Fertility Society classification (rAFS).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women patients aged between 18 and 46 years old
- Term ≥ 7 weeks amenorrhea and ≤ 14 weeks amenorrhea
- Blighted ovum or not completed miscarriage or haemorrhagic miscarriage or retention miscarriage
- Consent signature
- Social security coverage
- Women who wants to be pregnant
Exclusion Criteria:
- Infected miscarriage
- Uncertain diagnosis between miscarriage and extra-uterine pregnancy
- Hydatiform mole
- Uterine synechiae history
- Surgical zone infection
- Hyalobarrier® gel Endo hypersensitivity
- Clotting disorder
- Unstable diabetes
- Maternal malignant diseases
- Psychiatric disorder
- Incapacity in understanding the consent form and the questionnaires
- Law protected adult person
